displayName: Ensure no login exists with the name 'sa'
rationale: Enforcing this control reduces the probability of an attacker executing brute force attacks against a well-known principal name.
recommended_action:
Execute the appropriate `ALTER` or `DROP` statement below based on the `principal_id` returned for the login named `sa`. Replace the _`<different_name>`_ value within the below syntax and execute to rename the `sa` login.
```
USE [master]
GO
-- If principal_id = 1 or the login owns database objects, rename the sa login 
ALTER LOGIN [sa] WITH NAME = <different_name>;
GO
-- If the login owns no database objects, then drop it 
-- Do NOT drop the login if it is principal_id = 1
DROP LOGIN sa
```
ruleNames: Ensure no login exists with the name 'sa'
